newsitem.title: USA: Worthington Foods splits stock, hikes div.
newsitem.headline: Worthington Foods splits stock, hikes div.

text.p: Worthington Foods Inc said it set a four-for-three share split and raised its quarterly dividend by 11 percent to $0.025 per share.
The stock split will be distributed on December 6 to shareholders of record November 15.
The company said the dividend will be paid on January 27, 1997 to shareholders of record December 20, 1996.

Worthington also said its board has approved a $11.5 million capital expansion at its Zanesville plant. The project will add a second production line to produce hot-air oven veggie burgers and will also include construction of an additional 15,000 square foot dry storage warehouse.
The company said the expansion project is expected to be operational by mid-1997 and will have capacity for an additional $30 million in sales.
